Editing Options¶

The table can be aligned according to your requirements in the editing options area. You can:

  • filter
  • Hide and unhide columns
  • Change the column width and the order of the columns
  • Group
  • Execute task-specific operations

Filtering¶

  1. Click the filter symbol (the funnel).
  2. Enter your filter text in the text field that appears to the left of the filter symbol. The filter is not case sensitive.
  3. As soon as you start to type, the filter symbol is replaced with a delete symbol (red cross).
  4. The filter is executed as soon as you make a change. Each time you type a letter, the list of tasks displayed is reduced according to the filter criteria.
  5. If you want to remove the filter criteria, click the delete symbol or remove the text in the text field.
  6. The entire task list is then displayed once again.

Note

The filter text entered is applied to the displayed columns. The filter is not case sensitive.

Settings¶

Settings (click on the tool symbol to view) can be used to edit current view types or to create new view types. Settings can also be used to delete current view types.

The selection list for Settings is divided into three sub-areas:

  • The upper area allows the user to save or delete a number of view types for the table.
  • The central area allows the user to select defined view types.
  • The lower area allows the user to display and edit the settings of the current view type.

The upper area¶

Functions in the upper area¶
Function Execution
Save <…> Save <…> saves the new settings of the view type that is currently open.
Save as… Save as… saves the new settings of the view type that is currently open with a new name. This creates a new view type.
Clear settings… Clear settings… deletes view types created by the user. Click Clear settings…, select the view type you wish to delete and click Delete. The view type is deleted.

The central area¶

The user can define the view type displayed in the table in the central area of the selection list. The view can be called up with the default setting or with the settings defined by the user.

The lower area¶

The user can call up and edit the view type with the default setting or with the settings defined by the user in the lower area of the selection list. A new view type can also be created here.

Editing settings or creating a new view type¶

  1. Click the tool symbol.
  2. Select the view type you wish to edit in the central area.
  3. Click the tool symbol again.
  4. Click Settings <…> at the bottom of the selection list. The square brackets are replaced with the name of the view type you wish to edit.
  5. Make the required changes. Refer to the Editing settings table.
  6. If you want to change the current view type, click the tool symbol again and select Save <…> in the upper area.
  7. If you want to use the settings to create a new view type, click the tool symbol again, select Save as… in the upper area and specify a name for the new view type.

You can hide columns, group columns, sort columns and change the order of the columns for the selected view type. Please see the Editing settings table for instructions. Read the information here to find out how to change the column width.

Editing settings¶
Setting Execution
Hide columns Position the column headers from the left-hand side, with the column headers you wish to hide to the right.
Grouping Position the column headers from the left-hand side, with the column headers you wish to group to the right. Alternatively, you can follow the grouping instructions described here.
Sorting Position the column headers from the left-hand side, with the column headers you wish to sort by to the right. The order is important because the table is sorted by the first column header placed to the right first, followed by the next column to the right and so forth.
Order The columns are displayed in their current order. Move the cursor over a column header and slide this column header into the desired position between two other column headers.

Operations¶

Note

The selection of operations (represented by the three point symbol) is only visible when a task has been selected.

The operations that can be executed for the individual tasks depend on the task type.

  1. Select a task in the table.
  2. The three point symbol is displayed to the right of the tool symbol.
  3. Click the three point symbol.
  4. The operations that can be executed for the selected task are displayed (e.g. Status change or Share).

Examples of operations¶

The Delegate and Share operations are available for almost all task types. Therefore, the processes for executing these operations are described below.

Examples¶
Operation Execution
Delegate
  1. Select the Delegate operation.
  2. Open the selection list.
  3. Select a user or a role.
  4. Click Select.
  5. Confirm the dialog by clicking Delegate.
  6. The selected task will be delegated to the user or to the role.
Share
  1. Select the Share operation.
  2. The system opens the activities for this task in a new browser tab.
  3. Further information on sharing a task can be found in the Activities user manual.
